title: Mother goes on the run with her cancer-stricken son amid warning he will die unless she returns him
text:
Authorities are urgently searching for a four-year-old Nebraska boy and his mother, who has been charged with child abuse for allegedly ending her son's treatment for cancer and fleeing the state.

Abak Rehan is accused of taking her young son Prince after he missed several appointments at an Omaha hospital for treatment of Rhabdomyosarcoma.

A warrant for Abak's arrest was issued Thursday after she refused to discuss her son's treatment in a phone call with police on October 18.

She told the boy's father that she didn't like the care the boy was receiving and didn't want to continue with treatment, police said.

A social worker said Prince would likely die within six months to a year without treatment, and that the cancer could become more resistant by missing appointments even after treatment resumes, The Lincoln Journal Star reported.

He is supposed to have weekly appointments in Omaha and four to five chemotherapy treatments in Lincoln.

Abak Rehan, pictured, is accused of taking her son Prince after he missed appointments at a hospital in Omaha, Nebraska, for treatment of Rhabdomyosarcoma

Rehan, pictured left and right, told the boy's dad she didn't like the care the boy was receiving, police say. She had refused to discuss her son's treatment in a call with police on October 18. A warrant for Abak's arrest was issued Thursday as an urgent hunt was launched

In a court affidavit, Dr. Melissa Acquazzino, of Nebraska Pediatric Practice, said the boy is in imminent danger.

She put his chances of being cured at 60% with treatment and 0% without it.

Acquazzino said she believed it a 'matter of immediate and urgent necessity' that the child be placed in the custody of the Nebraska Department of Health and Human Services.



Police on October 9 spoke with the boy's father, who said Abak took their son to Arizona to get a second opinion because the treatments were making him sick.

When Rehan called Lincoln police investigator Luis Herrera on October 18, he asked if she was getting medical treatment for their son but she refused to discuss it, according to an arrest warrant issued Thursday.

'She was asked again and she would not answer, then later indicated she would not be returning to Nebraska,' Herrera said.

Police say it doesn't appear that Prince is receiving any medical care, as the boy's medical reports haven't been requested by any medical facility or provider and there hasn't been any activity detected on his Medicaid account.
description: Abak Rehan is accused of taking her son Prince after he missed appointments at a hospital in Omaha, Nebraska, for treatment of Rhabdomyosarcoma. A warrant for Abak's arrest was issued Thursday.
